review: Over the last year or two I've tried a couple other WiFi/HDMI interfaces for my TV, and this one simply works. The other two weren't functional enough to bother with. The more recent was a Chrome stick, and that was better than the first (brand escapes me right now) but didn't meet my needs for transparency and ease of use. I think Amazon has hit on the right combination of functionality and provider relationships. The Fire TV Stick was impressively easy to set up. The Netflix and Hulu+ set-ups were obvious and easy. And of course the stick came with my Amazon Prime account pre-loaded. I'm enjoying the use of this tool, and considering dropping some of the premium services I have on my [cable] account.
